page.title: 06COMMUNITY COUNCIL - DUNURE
page.content: Established in accordance with Section 51 of the Local Government (Scotland) Act 1973 and approved by Secretary of State for Scotland on 24 Dec. 1976. The objectives of the Council are to promote the well being of the Community resident in Dunure area by ascertaining,co-ordinating and expressing to the Local Authorities and to public bodies the views of the community and by taking such action in the interests of the community as appear expedient and practicable. The Council is non political and non sectarian.Council provides a third tier within Local Government structure and apart from village represents adjoining rural hinterland stretching from Culzean Bay and Pennyglen in south to Butlin's Holiday Camp in north.A focus of attention on local problems in age of centralisation.
